definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Still, Japan quickly suspended imports of American long-grain rice.
sentences.chinese: 日本立即做出反应，暂缓对美国长粒大米的进口。

sentences.english: Among grains, only rice is consumed in great quantities than wheat. (Todd Korol/Reuters)
sentences.chinese: 在所有谷物里，仅有大米的消耗量比小麦多。

sentences.english: Rice, cotton and vegetable seeds are sometimes grown in special seedbeds.
sentences.chinese: 有时，大米，棉花和蔬菜种子要在苗床培育。

sentences.english: In the Asian countries, most people rely on rice as their staple grain.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲国家，多数人依靠大米为食粮。

sentences.english: Stir in the rice and boil until just done, about 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 一边加入大米一边调和直到煮沸，大约10分钟。

sentences.english: She would also have "mad" binges, and eat nothing but rice cakes and butter.
sentences.chinese: 她还有“疯狂的”狂欢，只吃大米蛋糕和黄油。

sentences.english: They have many kinds of premium and quality rices .
sentences.chinese: 他们已经开发出了若干种品质优良的大米。
我们主要的出口货是大米。

sentences.english: It's not a food of mass consumption, like noodles or rice.
sentences.chinese: 这可不像面条或大米一样，是大众能消费的食物。

sentences.english: And about eighty percent of exports are long-grain rice.
sentences.chinese: 约百分之八十，出口长期粮食大米。

sentences.english: Dr Nochi's genetic engineering involved growing the vaccine in rice.
sentences.chinese: 博士的基因工程旨研究在大米中培养疫苗。

sentences.english: But the rice is genetically engineered.
sentences.chinese: 但黄金米是转基因大米。

sentences.english: Wash the rice in cold water until the water runs clear.
sentences.chinese: 用凉水冲洗大米，直到水变清为止。

sentences.english: On the second, I'd like two grains of rice.
sentences.chinese: 在第二个方格上，我想要两粒大米。

sentences.english: Warlords from Szechuan stopped sending rice down the Yangtze.
sentences.chinese: 四川军阀停止把大米运住长江下游。

sentences.english: In Asian countries, the majority of people depend on rice for food.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲国家，多数人依靠大米为食粮。

definition: grain crops other than rice and wheat
semipolished rice (i.e. rice minus the husk, but including the germ)
long-grained rice (Indian rice, as opposed to round-grained rice 粳米[jing1 mi3])
